comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content: W J and Master Corcoran are listed amongst those out with the Wexford Hounds in January 1898. The final result was: Wexford Hounds 0 Foxes 2 I assume he had himself photographed to commemorate his promotion to Master of the hunt 9 years later. No mention of check trousers, unfortunately. From Freeman's Journal and Daily Commercial Advertiser (where else), Friday, January 7, 1898

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johnspooner] As you say, where else would you be going but to the Freeman's Journal? And have have to say, I'm pleased about your score line! :) So location of Enniscorthy is sound then - thank you.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Also found in Thomas' Hunting Diary, 1905-1906, if you read around the OCR errors, that Mr Corcoran lived at Ballybane House, and was Master.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
